document_data.name: Aganazzar's Scorcher
document_data.inventor: [[Aganazzar]]<ref group="note">The spelling of his name was originally "Agannazar" in [[Forgotten Realms Adventures]] (page 45). The [[Forgotten Realms Campaign Setting 3rd edition]] uses "Aganazzar" on pages 66, 273, and 301 as does the [[Player's Guide to Faerûn]] on page 96. [[The Grand History of the Realms]] however spells it both ways: "Agannazar" on page 62, and "Aganazzar" on pages 88, 96, and 118. Using the latest and most frequent examples, his name is '''Aganazzar'''.
document_data.mainbody: '''''Aganazzar's scorcher''''' was an [[arcane]] [[evocation]] [[spell]] that created a destructive jet of flame.
document_data.History:
''Aganazzar's scorcher'' was created by the [[wizard]] [[Aganazzar]]. This spell was originally known to have been inscribed on the first page of the ''[[Tome of the Covenant]]'', a [[spellbook]] created by the four founders of the [[The Covenant|Covenant]], and Aganazzar was known to have given the spell to his apprentices.<ref><ref>

The [[church of Kossuth]] managed by [[1374 DR]] to convert this spell into one that [[cleric]]s who were introduced to their faith's secrets could cast.

The Red Wizards also got their hands on it and were known to use it shortly after Aganazzar's death. It saw widespread use by the [[Red Wizards of Thay]] and battle mages across [[Faerûn]].

The spell was known among [[elf|elven]] mages, who were known to craft magic [[ring of fire|''rings of fire'']] with it included with [[command word]] of [[Elven dictionary#Fete|''fete'']], meaning "fire". One of these rings was used by [[Dorigen Kel Lamond]] to cause havoc in [[Shilmista]] and, after taking it from Dorigen,<ref> [[Cadderly Bonaduce]] later used the same ring to slay the [[assassin]] [[Ghost (assassin)|Ghost]].<ref>

This spell was found in the pamphlet ''[[Volo's Guide to All Things Magical (in-universe)|Volo's Guide to All Things Magical]]'', published in [[1359 DR]].<ref name="FRA-p44>

[[Rimmen of the Scarlet Eye|Magelord Rimmen of the Scarlet Eye]],<ref> the [[sun elf]] [[wizard]] [[Meraera]],<ref> the energetic explorer known as [[Xara Tantlor]], the [[Moonstar]] [[Kyriani Agrivar]], [[Gromph Baenre]],{{Cite dragon/302/Rogues Gallery: The Heroes of the War of the Spider Queen|83}} and [[Pharaun Mizzrym]] knew how to cast this spell.{{Cite dragon/302/Rogues Gallery: The Heroes of the War of the Spider Queen|87}}
